titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Letters from David Wojnarowicz to Phillip Seymour MSS.647
titlestmt.author: Rachel Searcy

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-11-04 19:43:28 UTC.

did.unittitle: Letters from David Wojnarowicz to Phillip Seymour
did.abstract: David Wojnarowicz (1954-1992) met Phillip Seymour, who lived on Christopher Street in New York City, shortly before Wojnarowicz travelled to England and France in the fall of 1978. This collection consists of five letters from Wojnarowicz to Seymour written between 1978 and 1979. In the letters Wojnarowicz discusses writing; his childhood; difficulty finding employment; his journey from England to France and other travel experiences; daily life and the landscape of Normandy; and his reflections on homosexuality, including navigating societal pressures. The collection also includes a piece of driftwood Wojnarowicz sent Seymour along with the first letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of five letters from David Wojnarowicz to Phillip Seymour written between 1978 and 1979.In the letters Wojnarowicz discusses writing; his childhood; difficulty finding employment; his journey from England to France and other travel experiences; daily life and the landscape of Normandy; and his reflections on homosexuality, including navigating societal pressures. The collection also includes a piece of driftwood Wojnarowicz sent Seymour along with the first letter.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: The provenance of these materials prior their acquisition by the bookseller is unknown.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from James Cummins Bookseller in October 2024; the accession number associated with this purchase is 2024.038.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: On the advice of conservators, driftwood should remain in protective housing during use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Letters from David Wojnarowicz to Phillip Seymour; MSS 647; box number; folder number or item identifier; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning, piece of driftwood was inspected by a conservator and rehoused in protective housing. Materials were described on the collection-level with a folder-level inventory.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: David Wojnarowicz (1954-1992) met Phillip Seymour, who lived on Christopher Street in New York City, shortly before Wojnarowicz travelled to England and France in the fall of 1978.
